geo_id.Source(s): U.S. Census Bureau, 2015-2019 5-Year American Community Survey (ACS) Estimates

geography_name.Description: Census tract name with county and state names
geography_name.Source(s): U.S. Census Bureau, 2015-2019 ACS 5-Year Simplified Geography Files

rural.Description:
Rural/urban status 
"Rural" indicates tract is wholly contained in a rural area; "Not rural" denotes otherwise.
rural.Source(s): Digital Equity Act definition of "rural areas" applied to 2015-2019 5-Year American Community Survey (ACS) Estimates.

tract_tot_pop.Source(s):
U.S. Census Bureau, 2019 Modeled Total Covered Population Estimates, 
2019 Synthetic population.

tot_cov_pop.Description: 2019 Total covered populations in tract (population with 1 or more of the eight characteristics that make up the total covered populations as defined by the Digital Equity Act of 2021)
tot_cov_pop.Source(s):
U.S. Census Bureau, 2019 Modeled Total Covered Population Estimates.
Small area model of total covered populations derived from 2019 ACS 1-Year file, Vintage 2019 County and Puerto Rico Municipio Population Estimates, 2010 Decennial Census, 2015-2019 ACS 5-Year file, 2017 Program for the International Assessment of Adult Competencies (PIAAC) Household file and 2012/2014/2017 PIAAC State and County Small Area Estimates of Adult Skills on Literacy and Numeracy from the National Education Center for Education Statistics.

pct_tot_cov_pop.Description: 2019 Percentage of tract population in total covered populations
pct_tot_cov_pop.Source(s): U.S. Census Bureau, 2019 Modeled Total Covered Population Estimates.

ipr_pop.Description: 2015-2019 Tract household population in "covered households" (living in households with income-to-poverty ratio no more than 150 percent of federal poverty threshold)
ipr_pop.Source(s):
U.S. Census Bureau, 2015-2019 5-Year American Community Survey (ACS) Estimates.
Estimate is rounded to 4 significant digits.

pct_ipr_pop.Description: 2015-2019 Percentage of household population in "covered households" in tract (living in households with income-to-poverty ratio no more than 150 percent of federal poverty threshold)
pct_ipr_pop.Source(s): U.S. Census Bureau, 2015-2019 5-Year American Community Survey (ACS) Estimates
